column6: Change log is present and contains the required information (date, version, sections changed, summary of changes, reason, authors).
column9: Change log is present but inconsistent.

column6: Roles are explicit, unambiguous, and cover key responsibilities; a new member could understand who does what.
column9: Roles are defined but have minor gaps or overlap.
column12: Roles are missing or too vague to be useful.

column6: Decision model is clear (how decisions are proposed, debated, and finalized) with at least one explicit escalation/override rule.
column9: Decision process exists but is incomplete or lightly specified.

column6: Meeting cadence and communication tools/channels are clearly stated, including where decisions are documented.
DoD includes specific checks for tests, code review, documentation, and relevant quality/security/static analysis.
column9: DoD includes tests and review; some checks are missing or underspecified.

column6: Evidence (links/logs/screenshots) shows DoD is actually enforced (e.g., CI gates, review rules).
column9: Mentions enforcement, but evidence is limited.

column6: Conflict plan is restorative, time-bound, and includes clear steps from informal resolution to escalation.
column9: Conflict plan is present with reasonable steps; escalation exists.
column12: Conflict plan is missing, unclear, or punitive.

column6: Includes measurable triggers (e.g., missed meetings, unreviewed PR backlog) for when to escalate.
Accountability is tied to observable evidence (e.g., PRs, reviews, attendance/notes) rather than vague promises.
column9: Accountability is described but evidence ties are partial.

column6: Norms explicitly accommodate time zones, accessibility needs, and inclusive participation.
Clear process for requesting accommodations and how the team responds.
column9: Openness to accommodations stated but process is light.

column6: Key team risks are identified with clear escalation paths and triggers.
column9: Risks are listed with basic escalation guidance.
column12: Risks and/or escalation paths are missing.

column6: CONTRIBUTING.md includes all required elements: prerequisites/setup steps, local commands for CI/linting/formatting, the contribution workflow (branching + PR expectations) with a DoD reference and code review expectations, how to report bugs/requests (issues), and where to ask for help.
column9: CONTRIBUTING.md exists and covers the core workflow and local commands, but is missing one or more required elements (e.g., setup steps, issue reporting guidance, or help/contact info) and/or the DoD/review expectations are lightly specified.
column12: CONTRIBUTING.md is missing, empty, or too incomplete to follow (e.g., missing local commands and/or no usable contribution workflow).

column6: Concise, well-structured, polished; uses clear headings and bullets; stays close to the expected core length (~2â€“4 pages) while still being complete; images/media enhance readability.
column9: Mostly clear with some structure; minor readability issues or slightly off-target length.

column6: Professional tone; claims are precise and easy to follow; requirements and acceptance criteria use consistent formatting and are written in verifiable language.
column9: Generally clear; occasional ambiguity, inconsistent formatting, or awkward wording.
column12: Unclear or unprofessional tone; inconsistent or confusing requirement/AC wording.

column6: Images/media are legible and include alt text and short captions; links are descriptive; private links include lightweight screenshots/snippets so graders can evaluate.
column9: Some accessibility practices are used; minor gaps (e.g., missing some alt text/captions or vague link text).
column12: Missing alt text/captions or inaccessible formatting; evidence not evaluable due to inaccessible/private links.
